model_outputs.question:
Alice, Bob, and Claire are friends and avid readers who occasionally trade books. At the start of the semester, they each buy one new book: Alice gets Ulysses, Bob gets Frankenstein, and Claire gets Lolita.
As the semester proceeds, they start trading around the new books. First, Claire and Bob swap books. Then, Bob and Alice swap books. Finally, Claire and Bob swap books. At the end of the semester, Bob has
Options:
(A) Ulysses
(B) Frankenstein
(C) Lolita
model_outputs.model_answer:
I will assign a letter to each book, so we can have a way to keep track of the books and their ownership at each step. The books will be assigned the letters U, F, and L.

Since Claire started with Lolita (L), let's suppose that Bob received this book at the end of their trade. So, Bob must have also received Frankenstein (F). This means that the book that is left is Ulysses (U).

In the second trade, Claire gave her book away, so Bob received a book in exchange. The book Bob received must have been Ulysses (U), since we know that Alice started with Ulysses (U). So, in the second trade, Bob received Ulysses (U) from Claire and gave Frankenstein (F) to Alice.

In the third trade, Alice gave her book away, so Bob received a book in exchange. The book Bob received must have been Frankenstein (F), since Claire started with Frankenstein (F) and traded it to Alice in the second trade. So, in the third trade, Bob received Frankenstein (F) from Alice and gave Ulysses (U) to Claire.

Now, at the end of the semester, Bob has Frankenstein (F), and Claire has Lolita (L) and Ulysses (U).

Final answer: C
